intro: Phyllanthus gardneri var. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent phyllanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish-green flowers, which are typically borne in inflorescences. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The variety var. pubescens is distinguished by its hairy or pubescent surfaces on its stems and leaves, giving it a unique appearance.
